clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of the Tiger Catheter on Transradial Coronariography: Randomized Compared to JudKins cathETers
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of the Tiger Catheter as a Simple Multipurpuse Catheter in Transradial Coronariography: Randomized Comparerd to Judkins Catheters

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study was to assess effectiveness and safety of Tiger (5Fr) vs Judkins (5Fr) catheters, in coronariography via the right transradial approach.
This was a prospective, randomized, study of paralled design. Consecutive patients with acute coronary syndrome (ACS), eligible for coronary angiography, was randomized after successuful cannulation of right artery and informed consent to either Tiger or Judkins catheters.

detailed_description.textblock: analyzed a total of 120 consective diagnostic coronary angioggraphy cases from the right radial approach. Of these 60 cases were performed with single catheter (Tiger) and 60 cases were performed with conventional catheters (Judkins). The patients of both group were overall well balanced for gender, age, risk factors, height, weight and body surface area. Diagnostic angiograms were successfully achieved in all cases via the radial approach.

primary_outcome.measure: Produce time for the coronary angiography
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (corresponding to time point of produce) assessed by intention - to - tresat analysis (IIT)
primary_outcome.description: Produce time (min) was defined as the time from the insertion of the first diagnostic coronary catheter in the sheath to the exist of the las diagnostic catheter the sheath.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (corresponding to time point of produce)
secondary_outcome.description: Fluoroscopy time (min)was defined as fluoroscopy time during the procedure (between groups)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (corresponding to time point of produce)
secondary_outcome.description: contrast volume used (ml) was defined as the contrast volume between groups used for completion of coronary angiogram

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (corresponding to time point of produce). The radial artery spasm was recorded like YES or NOT.(registry did by nurse from beginning to end of coronary angiography)
secondary_outcome.description: Radial artery Spasm was defined as the discomfort or pain in the arm, between groups

arm_group.description: Tiger simple multipurpose catheter compared to Judkins catheters
Judkins right and judkins left catheter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- written informed consent
- indication for coronary angiography
Exclusion Criteria:
- negative AllenÂ´s test
- Chronic renal failure (to preserve the right radial artery for potencial arteriovenous shunting)
- Hemodynamic instability
- coronary artery bypass grafting

patient_data.ipd_description: The aim of this study was to assess effectiveness and safety of Tiger vs Judkins catheters, in coronary angiography.
